title: Change Order Readiness Assessment
description: Evaluate your organization's need for a formal change order management system

questions.question: Do you currently have a formal process for handling project change orders?
How are change requests currently documented in your organization?
What is your typical approval timeline for change orders?
How often do scope changes occur in your typical projects?
Have you experienced budget overruns due to undocumented or poorly managed changes?
How often do disputes arise with clients or stakeholders over change orders?
How many stakeholders typically need to approve a change order?
How do you communicate approved changes to project teams?
Is there clear accountability for change order decisions?
What tools do you currently use for project management?

answers.text: Project management software without change order features
Comprehensive PM software with change management

questions.question: Do you track metrics related to change orders (frequency, cost impact, approval time)?
Is your current change order process paper-based or digital?

answers.text: Mostly paper with some digital elements

questions.question: What is the typical value range of change orders in your projects?
How critical is efficient change management to your business success?

answers.text: Nice to have but not critical

questions.question: What is your primary goal for improving your change order process?

answers.text: Urgent need to prevent losses and disputes

levels.title: Critical Need for Change Order System
levels.description: Your organization is experiencing significant challenges with change order management. Implementing a formal system should be your top priority to prevent revenue loss and improve project outcomes.
recommendations: Immediately implement a formal change order process
Invest in dedicated change management software
Train all team members on new procedures
Establish clear approval workflows and accountability

levels.title: High Priority for Improvement
levels.description: Your current process has significant gaps that are likely impacting profitability and client satisfaction. A structured change order system would provide substantial benefits.
recommendations: Develop and document formal change order procedures
Evaluate and implement change management software

levels.title: Moderate Opportunity for Enhancement
levels.description: You have some good practices in place but there's room for improvement. Optimizing your change order process could increase efficiency and reduce friction.
recommendations: Consider upgrading to more integrated tools

levels.title: Process is Relatively Mature
levels.description: Your change order process appears to be functioning well. Focus on fine-tuning and maintaining your current system while looking for incremental improvements.
recommendations: Stay updated on industry best practices
Document lessons learned for continuous improvement
